pulsesuite.libpulsesuite.materialproperties.n0_sellmeier(A: float, B: numpy.ndarray, C: numpy.ndarray, lam: float) → float¶
Pure Sellmeier index formula:

n0 = sqrt(sum(B * lam^2/(lam^2 - C)) + A)

Clamped to 1.0 if NaN, <1.0, or >1e100.

exception pulsesuite.libpulsesuite.materialproperties.MaterialError¶

Bases: Exception

Custom exception for material property errors.

class pulsesuite.libpulsesuite.materialproperties.MaterialProperties(databasefile: str = 'materials_py.ini')¶

Port of the Fortran materialproperties module.

Preserves all original routines and naming conventions.

MAT_ERR_NOERROR = 0¶
MAT_ERR_NOFILE = 1¶
MAT_ERR_NOTFOUND = 2¶
MAT_ERR_FILE_FORMAT = 3¶
MAT_ERR_OUTOFRANGE = 4¶
MAT_ERR_BADVALUE = 5¶
MAT_ERR_DEFAULTUSED = 6¶
alpha(mat: str, lam: Annotated[float, numpy.float64], err: int | None = None) → Annotated[float, numpy.float64]¶

Linear absorption coefficient. Mirrors Fortran alpha.

  • lam (float, np.float64) –

  • err (int, optional) –

float

n0(mat: str, lam: Annotated[float, numpy.float64], err: int | None = None) → float¶

Refractive index: tries Sellmeier, falls back to discrete lookup.

Alias for n0(): more Pythonic name for the refractive index.

GetKW(mat: str, W: Annotated[numpy.ndarray, numpy.float64], err: int | None = None) → numpy.ndarray¶

Fortran GetKW: Kw[i] = 2π * n0(λ[i]) / λ[i], with λ = w2l(W).

Tr(mat: str, lam: Annotated[float, numpy.float64], err: int | None = None) → float¶

Raman response: discrete lookup with default=0 if not found.

pulsesuite.libpulsesuite.materialproperties.MaterialOptions(opt: str) → bool¶

Parse one command-line option. Returns True if handled (i.e. started with –material-datafile=).

pulsesuite.libpulsesuite.materialproperties.MatHelp()¶

Print help for the material-datafile flag.

pulsesuite.libpulsesuite.materialproperties.mat_error_handler(err: int, param: str, mat: str, lam: float)¶

Map error codes to warnings or exceptions.

pulsesuite.libpulsesuite.materialproperties.verify_G(mat: str, lam: Annotated[float, numpy.float64]) → None¶

Run finite-difference checks on the internal dispersion kernels, mirroring the Fortran verify_G subroutine.
